pageContext.claim: “The Secret Service said -- we have a statement from them -- they said that we could not travel because the helicopter couldn't be used. We would not be able to travel, because when you do that through a major city, it takes them days to get it prepared. I wanted to go anyway. I said let me just go separately in a car in disguise, I don't care.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump traveled to France in 2018 and was criticized for skipping a World War I memorial ceremony attended by other world leaders. He later said the Secret Service advised against flying the presidential helicopter in bad weather. But the event was 50 miles outside Paris. Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, German Chancellor Angela Merkel and French President Emmanuel Macron all somehow managed to brave the elements to get there.
